definitions.definition: deny (a person or place) the possession or use of something.
examples: the city was deprived of its water supplies
synonyms: rob of; Morecheat out of; informaldo out of "Adams was deprived of her civil rights"

definitions.definition: depose (someone, especially a member of the clergy) from office.
examples: Archbishop Bancroft deprived a considerable number of puritan clergymen
